attributes.action: Require care providers and all staff to be qualified and registered
attributes.background: Care is in crisis. There are regular reports of older and vulnerable people being abused and neglected. Most carers are hard-working professionals, but to increase confidence and standards everyone in the care industry should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: Staff at every level should be registered, increasing protection for the vulnerable but also placing carers on a professional footing. The cost of registration should be borne by providers. This register is not a criticism of hard-working care staff, and should increase their status and security, while registration of senior staff will enable them to be held accountable if they fail to provide good care.

attributes.action: Murdered 4 y/o British national: Urge Pakistani government to deliver justice
attributes.background: This murder has been overlooked for 4 years. Shahryar Ahmad, a British national, was kidnapped outside his grandmother's home in Faisalabad, Pakistan on 21 August 2014, and subsequently murdered by the gang who abducted him.
attributes.additional_details: I, Iftkhar Ahmad, Shahryar's father,  was led to believe for almost 4 months that the kidnappers were holding him for ransom, however it was later discovered that my little boy’s body was found by the police, dumped in a canal a mere 2 days after his abduction. Justice has not been delivered to Shahryar or my family. Urgent intervention by the UK government and parliament is necessary.

attributes.action: To dedicate more resources to help men and young boys with mental health issues
attributes.background: As a young man, I’m scared to see statistics about male suicides. It is shocking that very little is being done to tackle the problem of mental health, and more needs to be done to help men and young boys with depression, anxiety and stress among with other issues
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11787304/Homelessness-is-a-gendered-issue-and-it-mostly-impacts-men.html

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/birthsdeathsandmarriages/deaths/bulletins/suicidesintheunitedkingdom/2016registrations#main-points

attributes.action: Offer support to Greece regarding the Mati Wildfire Crisis
attributes.background: The Mati wildfire has burned through village, causing 74 fatalities so far, with that number "expected to rise", and with little control over the fire. The United Kingdom should offer assistance in the form of firefighters, aircraft and vehicles to assist the struggling victims of the fire.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.reviewjournal.com/news/nation-and-world/death-toll-from-greece-fires-reaches-74-is-expected-to-rise/amp/

attributes.action: Create mandatory Register for Acid Attack Offenders
attributes.background: UK is amongst the countries with highest rate of acid attacks. There is a trend them increasing in number, just in London those being doubled since 2014, inspite of Government actions so far. Register is one of the possible actions promoting 'zero-tolerance' approach.
attributes.additional_details:
Acid attacks are not just another violent attack. 
- they are not impulsive, but require preparation and are premeditated
- they don't inflict controlled damage, but as much damage and suffering possible - that makes them also vicious

Register would ease limitting access to such substances, through purchase or by performing a particular role. It could protect public in certain circumstances (similar to Sarah's Law and Clare's Law) or allow for easier monitoring and swiffter police reaction.

attributes.action: Change the law on drink driving to no drink at all while in charge of a vehicle
attributes.background: Stop drinking while driving completely, as in you cannot have any alcohol while in charge of any vehichle! To many people lose there loves one through someone else's irresponsible actions, yet all they get in return of taking a life is a couple years in prison at the most.
attributes.additional_details: We need a tougher punishment for this crime such as longer prison time and harsher license loss, if over the limit if you cause an accident it should be you lose your license for more than 5 years followed by a prison sentence minimum punishment. UK laws are to lax time to make them tougher. Save lives not lose them!!

attributes.action: Prevent absent parents from travelling outside the UK if maintenance is unpaid
attributes.background: Recently Australia enforced action against parents with child support debts from travelling in and out of the country until they had settled their arrears. Introducing a similar law into the UK would benefit many UK families and make absent parents face up to their responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2018/may/27/child-support-debts-record-number-of-parents-prevented-from-travelling-overseas

attributes.action: Ban Staples From Newspapers
attributes.background: Staples are an unnecessary addition to newspapers which are an environmental liability - this petition asks the government to ban the use of staples in newspaper production.
attributes.additional_details:
Staples are for the most part made using steel which is produced with the requirement of a blast furnace and this using large amounts of energy. No staples would also mean that newspapers would be more easily recyclable due to the absence of metal and the decay of newspapers would be much increased.
Banning staples would bring down production costs for newspaper companies And would create a safer environment in factories.

attributes.action: Work with EU to allow promotion/marketing of infant formula milk(under 6months)
attributes.background: Currently you are unable to to gain advantage points from supermarkets and reatailers such as boots on formula milk (for under 6 months) you can also not buy formula with these advantage points. This is due to a law that prevents the promotion or discount of formula milk for under 6 month olds.
attributes.additional_details: the price of formula is regulated as to stop 'formula shopping' and prevent people from buying the cheapest formula they can find, as this enables mother/fathers to use one brand or staggared brands through out infancy- they were finding that babies where becoming really unwell by getting fed different formulas every week. It also prevents supermarkets trying to push formula that is close to expire. But parents should be able to gain advantage points on buying formula milk.

attributes.action: Introduce yearly mental health checks on the NHS
attributes.background: With how society is nowadays, it is very easy to find yourself struggling. An annual mental health check will give everyone a chance to talk about their feelings to a trained professional who will be able to react to this in a more proactive way than a friend who may not know how to deal with it.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide is now at its all time highest, with it being the most common cause of death for men aged 20-49 across England and Wales. More and more pressures have emerged that we as humans were not originally designed to deal with such as financial worries, the rise of social media and having demanding jobs so there is no wonder 1 in 15 of us have made a suicide attempt at some point in our lives.

attributes.action:
Allow a 
Referendum on changing the House Of Lords to a fully Elected Chamber
attributes.background: Abolition of the House of Lords has been debated. No clear way forward to address people’s concerns was forthcoming; though their was some acknowledgement of it overstepping it’s remit, particularly to thwart the people’s decision for Brexit. The chamber needs to better reflect people’s wishes.
attributes.additional_details: An elected chamber, drawn from all walks of life and being fully representative of the electorate should replace the current system. There should not be allowed to be overwhelming numbers from one particular political party or persuasion. Elected members should not need to be past MPs and could be experts in their field - elected to scrutinise in particular areas. People need to be able to trust that the powers given to scrutinise are not abused, nor guided by personal agenda or preference.

attributes.action: Fine parents who refuse to have regular contact with their children.
attributes.background: Parents who choose not see their children regularly subject them to feelings of abandonment. More action and strict policies should be in place to enforce regular contact. Where possible, children need their both parents.

attributes.action: Mandatory 5 year prison sentence for carrying a knife on the first offence
attributes.background: The streets of the United Kingdom have been lost to knife wielding thugs who suffer  little or no consequence for their actions. Social media and local news is awash with videos and images of knives on our streets. The two strike rule has failed. A mandatory 5 year sentence must be enforced for all.

attributes.action: Give people needing intimate care a right to have it by carers of the same sex
attributes.background: I am concerned that some vulnerable and/or elderly people needing intimate personal care, in their own homes or in care homes are having to suffer the indignity of intimate care several times a day, every day and have no right to refuse to have it carried out by someone of the opposite gender.
attributes.additional_details:
My elderly mother was refused her request to have 2 ladies attend her intimate care by a local care agency.  Luckily for her I was able to assist and ensure the male carer wait in the hall.  
It is not currently a right to have someone of the same gender attend to intimate care.  I think it should be.

attributes.action: Apology from British government for 1919 Jallianwala Bagh Massacre in India
attributes.background: On 13 April 1919, Col R. Dyer of British Indian Army ordered soldiers to fire onto a crowd of pilgrims gathered in Jallianwala Bagh, Amritsar, India to celebrate the holy festival of Baishakhi. Dyer got all exits blocked to deliver maximum fatality killing hundreds of innocent unarmed civilians
attributes.additional_details:
Well documented incident which is the worst among many crimes committed by the colonising British. The pre-planned massacre puts the official deaths as 387. Dyer admitted that 1650 rounds were fired into a trapped crowd including elderly, kids and women. Unofficially casualties are estimated to be over 1000.

On the centenary of this horrific crime, the british government must tender an apology to the people of India in 2019

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jallianwala_Bagh_massacre#The_massacre

attributes.action: Remove Arriva of their contract for disruptions to people and the economy
attributes.background:
Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%

We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for limited speed vehicles from overtaking on dual carriageways.
attributes.background: Lorries overtaking on dual carriageways takes a considerable amount of time and holds up all traffic behind them. This causes delays and considerable frustration to other road users, and dangerous driving results from impatient car drivers.
attributes.additional_details: The speed limit for lorries on a dual carriageways is 60mph. Cars and other vehicles are limited to 70mph. Considering the numbers of cars to other vehicles on the road, it is illogical to allow limited vehicles to block both carriageways for considerable lengths of time causing delays for many other road users.

attributes.action: Fund Carbon removal factories CDC & DAC in the UK powered by renewable energy.
attributes.background: Carbon pollution is acidifying our oceans, killing our wildlife and destroying our planet. This is unacceptable considering technology already exists that can extract Carbon from the atmosphere. Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDC) and Direct Air Capture (DAC) can catch 1 million tons of CO2 per year.
attributes.additional_details: Right now there is technology known as "Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDC)" and "Direct Air Capture (DAC)" that can remove carbon from our atmosphere. If this technology was rolled out on a national scale it will save lives, it will improve our Air. Powered by Renewable energies evidence suggests this tech could capture 1 million tons of CO2 Per Year. Recent studies show 1 in 6 deaths are linked to all forms of pollution in the UK. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on fuel for the road haulage industry
attributes.background: Reduce fuel tax for the road haulage industry.
attributes.additional_details: Fuel is the biggest out may in road haulage. The cost is increasing and forcing small business into financial stuggle. The reduce in tax would encourage hauliers to expand and boost the economy. Increase wages run more fuel efficient/green vehicles

attributes.action: Diagnosed mental health patients should receive free prescriptions
attributes.background: Without medication mental health patients can die, they are three times more likely to develop additional physical problems such as diabetes, heart disease and addictions, all of which can reduce life expectancy.
attributes.additional_details:
Mental illness is considered a disability, question behaviour, whether stable and/or taking medication. 
Mind organisation have already researched the definition and terms of disability in conjunction with the Equality Act, 2010. Mental health is included. 
Diagnosed mental health problems should qualify an individual for free prescriptions in the same way as some medical conditions and physical disabilities.

attributes.action: Introduce a 12-month residency requirement for candidates to Parliament
attributes.background: In order for Parliament to become truly representative, this petition proposes introducing legislation to require persons standing for Parliament to be resident in their constituency for at least 12 months prior to election day.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is meant to be a representative democracy.  However, parties will often choose a favoured member to run for a seat to maximise their chances of winning, even though they have no genuine connection to the local community.  As a result, Parliament is not a collection of community representatives, but a collection of preferred party members.

attributes.action: Make charging extortionate amounts for the equivalent gluten free items illegal
attributes.background: Gluten free items are typically at least double or triple the cost of standard items which is essentially exploitation against those genetically susceptible and intolerant/reactive to gluten. Is this not indirect discrimination, treating this population differently? This has been so hard for me.
attributes.additional_details:
A gluten free lifestyle can be tough enough without having to pay extortionate amounts for food and for small amounts. Its been difficult to switch to a gluten free diet not just physically and mentally but also financially. This should not be the case. 
Severe abdominal pain, fatigue, indigestion, bloating, vomiting and anaemia are just a few of the symptoms you can experience by eating gluten with such conditions like Celiac and IBS. Now, thousands of people are affected. We can help them.

attributes.action: Make Bonfire Night a National Holiday
attributes.background:
Between August bank holiday and Christmas there are no national holidays in the UK. This leaves millions of people with nothing to look forward to for months on end and has led to the overhyping of Christmas. 
We need another holiday to look forward to. We DESERVE another day of celebration.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose we make Bonfire Night a national holiday. The Americans and Canadians have Thanksgiving but it doesn't seem right to copy this. 
Instead let's make the quintessentially British Bonfire Night a national holiday. 
Communities can come together and make/share food. Kids doing 'penny for the guy'. We need this. 
Let's make it happen!

attributes.action: Fund clinical trials in Alzheimer's based on the aldehyde toxicity hypothesis
attributes.background: There is increasing evidence to suggest Alzheimer's is caused by aldehyde toxicity. It stands to reason that medical protocol based on this hypothesis could be invaluable in the prevention and treatment of this devastating neurodegenerative condition afflicting the ageing population.
attributes.additional_details:
Public funding should be used to investigate a therapeutic cocktail of the following compounds in clinical trials to reduce the economic burden of Alzheimer's and dementia and improve quality of life in the ageing population:

N-acetylcysteine (NAC)
Niacin (nicotinic acid form)
Zinc
Molybdenum
Alpha lipoic acid
Selenium
Sulforaphane

Collectively, these compounds are integral in aldehyde detoxification and would present a powerful weapon against neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer's.

attributes.action: Boost UK trade and global image by inviting China and Japan to rename islands
attributes.background: Britain is a force for good in the world. Remain and Brexit voters agree that we need to show the world that we are open for business. By brokering a new name for the disputed Senkaku/Diaoyu islands in the East China Sea, the Foreign Office can highlight our shared values - and encourage trade.
attributes.additional_details: China and Japan are the second and third biggest economies in the world and are creating investment and jobs in British industry. They dispute who owns a group of islands in the East China Sea. Resolving the dispute is a matter for China and Japan, but the UK can play a valuable role by symbolically inviting the two governments to rename the islands to reflect their and our shared values - for example the Confucius Islands or the Friendship Islands. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senkaku_Islands

attributes.action: Ban escort review websites like UK Punting
attributes.background: On certain online escort review discussion boards, such as UK Punting, users submit aggressive & potentially defamatory posts about women. These websites ask for reviews to contain a link, contact details or address of the escort, which can put them at risk.
attributes.additional_details: The posts may contain unfounded accusations and fake reviews. Pictures of the escorts can be posted without consent. Such sites are dangerous to ALL women, not just sex workers. Appearing on them can lead to women being harassed, outed and having their addresses made public, which could result in criminal damage and burglary. Users can even post pictures of women in the street and give derogatory accounts of what they would like to do to them in locked sections of these forums.

attributes.action: All English Local Authorities to notify residents by post of new Consultations
attributes.background: When introducing any legislation affecting residents, The Local Authority/Council must serve notice of any consultation or proposal directly on ALL residents, in additional languages if required, by way of postal service. Local Authorities across England are failing to comply with this requirement
attributes.additional_details: A specific example of this is the introduction of Selective Licensing in Luton, ALL residents in the affected areas have not been informed of the Consultation. The outcome of this consultation will affect all residents of Luton. We are asking for people across England to support this if they have had a similar experience with their Local Authority failing to consult with them on important changes affecting their town/city.

attributes.action: Make EV charging as easy as filling up with petrol/diesel fuel.
attributes.background: Make all charging stations accept credit or debit cards or maybe cash with no prior membership. The cost per kWh should also be displayed in the same way as fuel prices are displayed on forecourts. EV uptake will be significantly improved if owners know they can easily charge anywhere.
attributes.additional_details: To charge an EV currently requires one to be a member of a variety of different clubs with different schemes and maybe club cards in order to access charging power points. I usually charge at home but recently tried charging at a charging point but failed. I had installed Polar instants on my phone with credit but either I didn't have mobile data access or the polar servers weren't working but I was unsuccessful. Fortunately I just had enough charge to limp home.

attributes.action: I want Government to create a law so Ayahuasca can be used legally in the UK
attributes.background:
It is a very helpful tool in allowing an individual who feels they want to explore themselves deeper and promotes healing; physically/ physchologically & spiritually. 
Ayahuasca promotes acceptance and resistance, giving power to the individual to decide, what is for them, their best way of being.
attributes.additional_details:
With facilitators supervising space, this provides a safe opportunity to experience the medicine

It is the use of Banisteriopsis caapi. 
A brew of B. caapi & P. viridis is the traditional South American brew. The caapi is particularly important as traditionally the caapi itself is considered to be “ayahuasca” while the DMT-containing plants are simply helpers.

Ayahuasca, also known as yage, is a blend of two plants - the ayahuasca vine and a shrub called chacruna (Psychotria viridis)

attributes.action: Prohibit the manafacture and commercial distribution of cigarettes within the UK
attributes.background:
Ever hour around the world, 800 people die as a result of the most lethal human creation - cigarettes. These small paper rolls kill more people on average around the globe than AK47's

So why is it so ironic that countries prohibit smoking in public but still allow toxic tobacco manufacturing ?
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 4 million hectares of deforestation for cigarette fuels and paper wrapping.

This industry kills 7 million people ever year

So why can we as humans not recognise that this substance would be better off if completely irradicated. Why is it seen as though the manafacturers care more about their profits than the health of people around the globe. 

And unfortunately, "smoking kills" just isn't enough.

attributes.action: Change Abortion law to a period of 12 weeks instead of 24 weeks.
attributes.background: The Irish are proposing to introduce legislation that will restrict Category C abortions to 12 weeks, whilst we continue to allow abortions up to 24 weeks - far beyond the time when a baby can survive outside the womb.  This needs changed.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017 there were 194,668 legal abortions carried out in England & Wales (ie just over 745 abortions per working day). Of these, 98% (185,448) were carried out under category C. Of these, 99.5% were reported as being performed because of a risk to the woman’s mental health. In 13 cases, an abortion was performed under category C because of complications of pregnancy. Source - Abortion Statistics, England and Wales: 2017, Department of Health & Social Care

attributes.action: Add metric km/h to speed signs under the imperial mph sign.
attributes.background: So as the Metric system is a lot easier to convert lengths through I think we should convert our measurements to km/h while keeping the mph sign for old road users. I think we should add the km/h sign under the mph road sign with a different coloured ring (green maybe) and km/h after it.
attributes.additional_details: This would make it easier to judge distance for younger people as younger people are being taught the metric system. As most cars have km/h along side mph this would mean it would have almost instant impact. Also it is great for tourists and european people that come from a totally metric county drive safer.

attributes.action: Offer free life and employability skills to young offenders.
attributes.background: With the alarming increase in youth violence, it is crucial to not only prevent it spreading- but to help those already involved. A criminal record can lessen the chance of employment, and without being taught necessary skills and given support those young people may fall back into their old ways.
attributes.additional_details: Article 26 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights state that we have a right to education, and educating young offenders on ways in which they can turn their lives around and overcome all adversities is better than any national curriculum.

attributes.action: Make the House of Lords appointment process fully independent from government.
attributes.background: Peers are appointed by the Queen on the prime minister's advice. Some members are recommended by an independent body, called the House of Lords Appointments Commission, but only for non-party-political individuals. This process allows government to tip the balance in the Lords for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
The government's power to select members of the House of Lords, leaves the Chamber open to unethical appointments, for example the recent selection made by Prime Minister Theresa May, which appears to be an attempt at quelling opposing voices inside government: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-44167066
This should never be allowed. A fully independent body must be set up to elect peers to the House of Lords.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to allow your dog to have access to your letterbox
attributes.background: Dog attacks are on the increase. Many bites happen when items are pushed through letterboxes. I feel it should be the law to either have a box fitted externally, a box fitted internally so a dog can’t get to the letterbox or the dog inaccessible to the back of the front door (behind internal door).
attributes.additional_details:
I have worked as a postman and also as a courier and have seen and heard so many stories of dog bites due to delivering mail, parcels or a ‘left with neighbour card’. Recently a person lost their finger due to posting a card through a letterbox. Bringing this law in would stop these needless and sometimes life changing injuries. Something needs to be addressed and sooner rather than later. 
Please sign this petition. Thank you.

attributes.action: All Mainstream Schools should have the resources to teach deaf children.
attributes.background: Pupils with special needs have a basic right to a mainstream education and the increased opportunity for social interaction with their peers that this brings. Mainstream participation allows everybody the opportunity to learn to understand the diversity of human ability, without prejudice.
attributes.additional_details:
In Manchester there are currently only 2 schools with the resource to teach deaf children. Both in the same area of Manchester, so the council pay to transport children from all over Manchester to these 2 schools. To clarify 'resource' is a room where a teacher for the deaf can do some quiet work with the deaf children. 
There are new schools being built all the time, surely this is a perfect opportunity to add the resource bases the schools need. The deaf teachers are already here and trained.

attributes.action: Stop all councils from using enforcement agencies, bailiffs and threats of court
attributes.background: Council tax and poverty don't mix! If you are unable to pay on time you will be put into debt by your council. Theres no communication with customers they pass your bill to enforcement agencies with added fees,threats of ballifs,court and jail. If you believe this shouldn't be happening please sign.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for cyclists to overtake on the nearside of traffic
attributes.background:
There have recently been several cyclist deaths due to traffic turning left and not seeing the cyclist. This is a preventable by stopping cyclists from coming up the nearside of vehicles.
Stopping this behaviour will save lives.

attributes.action: Amend Highway Code to include guidance for pothole avoidance
attributes.background: With the increasing number of unmarked dangerous defects in our road surfaces nationwide, there is no guidance in the Highway Code regarding a safe approach. Does one brake sharply, swerve, or proceed over the defect rendering your vehicle or motorcycle uncontrollable and potentially damaged?

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence not to report child abuse
attributes.background: If children report abuse to an adult, including a family member, that adult must be required by law to report it to the police. Too many families choose to keep quiet to protect their (family) honour and/ or careers and let the defenceless child suffer.

attributes.action: Introduce Black History Month to the curriculum for primary and secondary school
attributes.background:
It is vital that we inform the younger generation of the struggles and injustice that was faced by black people. It is imperative that we are all aware of the past and the addition to the curriculum will give all races the opportunity to learn about the past. 

Through knowledge comes progression.

attributes.action: Give students free dental care and prescriptions on the NHS
attributes.background: Most students do not have any income, or if they do it is very minimal. Most students cannot afford dental treatment or prescriptions and avoid going to the doctors or dentist. This can mean that medical problems can go untreated and thus cost the NHS more in the long term.

attributes.action: Make carers allowance payable to carers after they reach pensionable age.
attributes.background: I have cared for my husband for the last 18+years after he sustained a traumatic brain injury. I had to give up my full time job to do this and now I find that I am going to loose CA  when I  reach pensionable age which I feel is grossly unfair as I am still a full time carer.

attributes.action: End dog on dog attacks
attributes.background:
Currently there is no law to protect our dogs which is enforced, when a dog attacks or kills another dog. 
The government need to update the dangerous dogs act 1991 and make the owners liable for prosecution if an attack happens.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 19th August 2018 our blind 14yr old toy poodle was savagely attacked by two American bulldogs. She was playing in the long grass when the two dogs saw movement and hunted her. The dogs were too strong and she couldn’t be saved. 
We need to fight to save all other dogs lives from dangerous dogs which are not correctly restrained. 
We can’t bring Emma or the other dogs who have lost their lives back but we can try and change the future. 
#EmmasLaw

attributes.action: Introduce a statue of limitations for Army veterans
attributes.background: British Army veterans are being investigated for alleged wrongdoings that took place over 40 years ago in Northern Ireland , even though in many cases they were thoroughly investigated at the time . The introduction of a statute of limitations would prevent this from happening in the future .

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the USA
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I am now 21 years of age and at an age where I feel I can make judgement on who MY father should be. The fact that I cannot be adopted my a man who has stood by me for years because I am “too old” is completely against my rights.
attributes.additional_details: I intend on getting the law changed so that myself and others can make this descision. Many people do it for different reasons. It should be a choice that can be made at any time in an adults life.

attributes.action: Scrap QTS professional skills test for those with learning disabilities.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of prospective teachers wanting to teach in various subjects apply for teacher training in the U.K. As a requirement set by the government, they are required  to undertake the Numeracy and Literacy QTS Professional Skills Test.
attributes.additional_details: For many people this may not cause any issues. However,  for the prospective teachers who have a learning disability struggle to the point where passing the test is out of their reach. I and many others believe this to be discrimination against those with a disability, as they are being turned away from pursuing their teaching career through no fault of their own. Therefore, I would like to propose that those with a learning disability, be exempt from QTS Professional Skills Tests.

attributes.action: Ban discrimination in private rental sector towards people on benefits
attributes.background: It’s become increasingly difficult to find a letting agent/ landlord that will accept people on low incomes with top up benefits. The Government should have some input on this due to the lack of council properties available to those in need.
attributes.additional_details: I have been searching for a 2 bedroom property for myself and my daughter for a few months and the stumbling block is always the fact that I receive working/child tax credit and housing benefit. This in my opinion is discriminatory towards those on low incomes who need that extra help because they are not in a position to work full time.

attributes.action: Encourage the public to let paramedics on lunch break to skip lines in shops
attributes.background: Resources for the emergency services are being stretched already. Some paramedics work 12 hour shifts, and get from 15 minute to 45 minute breaks. However, demand often outstrips available ambulances, and a lot of paramedics voluntarily stop their break earlier to get to a life threatened patient.
attributes.additional_details:
The West Midlands Ambulance Service state that in a huge majority of cases, "ambulance crews will voluntarily stop their breaks in order to get to immediately life threatened patients quickly". 

Source: https://wmas.nhs.uk/about-wmas/patient-safety/nhs-ambulance-service-rest-and-meal-breaks/

The Government should make a campaign to encourage the public to let paramedics skip queues in shops while they are on their break.

attributes.action: Require a minimum 30 minute rest break in a 12-hour shift by law
attributes.background: You are entitled to one rest break of 20 mins if you are employed for more than six hours a day. Therefore, even on a 12-hour shift, you are only legally entitled to ONE 20 mins rest break. This Petition is asking Parliament to change the law, to require a longer break time.
attributes.additional_details:
Andrew Griffiths MP, Minister for Small Business, Consumers & Corporate Responsibility replied on 7 June 2018 to my MP's letter: 
"We keep all our employment regulations under review, including the Working Time Regulations (WTR) 1998 which contain the statutory requirements on rest breaks. 

We currently have no plans to review these provisions, the WTR represent the minimum requirements and employers are free to offer more generous terms to their workers through their employment contracts".
